TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EnvironmentalReverb extends Android.Media.Audiofx.AudioEffect

Docs.summary: A sound generated within a room travels in many directions.

remarks.para: A sound generated within a room travels in many directions. The listener first hears the direct sound from the source itself. Later, he or she hears discrete echoes caused by sound bouncing off nearby walls, the ceiling and the floor. As sound waves arrive after undergoing more and more reflections, individual reflections become indistinguishable and the listener hears continuous reverberation that decays over time. Reverb is vital for modeling a listener's environment. It can be used in music applications to simulate music being played back in various environments, or in games to immerse the listener within the game's environment. The EnvironmentalReverb class allows an application to control each reverb engine property in a global reverb environment and is more suitable for games. For basic control, more suitable for music applications, it is recommended to use the android.media.audiofx.PresetReverb class.
An application creates a EnvironmentalReverb object to instantiate and control a reverb engine in the audio framework.

The methods, parameter types and units exposed by the EnvironmentalReverb implementation are directly mapping those defined by the OpenSL ES 1.0.1 Specification (http://www.khronos.org/opensles/) for the SLEnvironmentalReverbItf interface. Please refer to this specification for more details.

The EnvironmentalReverb is an output mix auxiliary effect and should be created on Audio session 0. In order for a MediaPlayer or AudioTrack to be fed into this effect, they must be explicitely attached to it and a send level must be specified. Use the effect ID returned by getId() method to designate this particular effect when attaching it to the MediaPlayer or AudioTrack.
Creating a reverb on the output mix (audio session 0) requires permission android.Manifest.permission#MODIFY_AUDIO_SETTINGS
See android.media.audiofx.AudioEffect class for more details on controlling audio effects.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub New (priority As Integer, audioSession As Integer)
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 priority, int32 audioSession) cil managed

Docs.param: the priority level requested by the application for controlling the EnvironmentalReverb engine. As the same engine can be shared by several applications, this parameter indicates how much the requesting application needs control of effect parameters. The normal priority is 0, above normal is a positive number, below normal a negative number.

system wide unique audio session identifier. If audioSession is not 0, the EnvironmentalReverb will be attached to the MediaPlayer or AudioTrack in the same audio session. Otherwise, the EnvironmentalReverb will apply to the output mix. As the EnvironmentalReverb is an auxiliary effect it is recommended to instantiate it on audio session 0 and to attach it to the MediaPLayer auxiliary output.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property DecayHFRatio As Short
public: virtual property short DecayHFRatio { short get(); void set(short value); };
public virtual short DecayHFRatio { get; set; }
member this.DecayHFRatio : int16 with get, set

Docs.param: high frequency decay ratio using a permille scale. The valid range is [100, 2000]. A ratio of 1000 indicates that all frequencies decay at the same rate.
Docs.summary: Gets the ratio of high frequency decay time (at 5 kHz) relative to low frequencies. -or- Sets the ratio of high frequency decay time (at 5 kHz) relative to the decay time at low frequencies.
Docs.value: the decay HF ration. See #setDecayHFRatio(short) for units.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Gets the ratio of high frequency decay time (at 5 kHz) relative to low frequencies.
Property setter documentation:
Sets the ratio of high frequency decay time (at 5 kHz) relative to the decay time at low frequencies.

public: virtual property int DecayTime { int get(); void set(int value); };
public virtual int DecayTime { get; set; }
member this.DecayTime : int with get, set

Docs.param: decay time in milliseconds. The valid range is [100, 20000].
Docs.summary: Gets the decay time. -or- Sets the time taken for the level of reverberation to decay by 60 dB.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Gets the decay time.
Property setter documentation:
Sets the time taken for the level of reverberation to decay by 60 dB.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property Density As Short
public: virtual property short Density { short get(); void set(short value); };
public virtual short Density { get; set; }
member this.Density : int16 with get, set

Docs.param: density specified using a permille scale. The valid range is [0, 1000]. A value of 1000 o/oo indicates a natural sounding reverberation. Values below this level produce a more colored effect.
Docs.summary: Gets the density level. -or- Controls the modal density of the late reverberation decay.
Docs.value: the density level. See #setDiffusion(short) for units.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Gets the density level.
Property setter documentation:
Controls the modal density of the late reverberation decay.

The scale should approximately map linearly to the perceived change in reverberation. A lower density creates a hollow sound that is useful for simulating small reverberation spaces such as bathrooms.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property Diffusion As Short
public: virtual property short Diffusion { short get(); void set(short value); };
public virtual short Diffusion { get; set; }
member this.Diffusion : int16 with get, set

Docs.param: diffusion specified using a permille scale. The diffusion valid range is [0, 1000]. A value of 1000 o/oo indicates a smooth reverberation decay. Values below this level give a more grainy character.
Docs.summary: Gets diffusion level. -or- Sets the echo density in the late reverberation decay.
Docs.value: the diffusion level. See #setDiffusion(short) for units.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Gets diffusion level.
Property setter documentation:
Sets the echo density in the late reverberation decay.
The scale should approximately map linearly to the perceived change in reverberation.

public: virtual property int ReflectionsDelay { int get(); void set(int value); };
public virtual int ReflectionsDelay { get; set; }
member this.ReflectionsDelay : int with get, set

Docs.param: reflections delay in milliseconds. The valid range is [0, 300].
Docs.summary: Gets the reflections delay. -or- Sets the delay time for the early reflections.
Docs.value: the early reflections delay in milliseconds.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Gets the reflections delay.
Property setter documentation:
Sets the delay time for the early reflections.
This method sets the time between when the direct path is heard and when the first reflection is heard.

Docs.param: reflection level in millibels. The valid range is [-9000, 1000].
Docs.summary: Gets the volume level of the early reflections. -or- Sets the volume level of the early reflections.
Docs.value: the early reflections level in millibels.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Gets the volume level of the early reflections.
Property setter documentation:
Sets the volume level of the early reflections.
This level is combined with the overall room level (set using #setRoomLevel(short)).

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property RoomHFLevel As Short
public: virtual property short RoomHFLevel { short get(); void set(short value); };
public virtual short RoomHFLevel { get; set; }
member this.RoomHFLevel : int16 with get, set

Docs.param: high frequency attenuation level in millibels. The valid range is [-9000, 0].
Docs.summary: Gets the room HF level. -or- Sets the volume level at 5 kHz relative to the volume level at low frequencies of the overall reverb effect.
Docs.value: the room HF level in millibels.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Gets the room HF level.
Property setter documentation:
Sets the volume level at 5 kHz relative to the volume level at low frequencies of the overall reverb effect.
This controls a low-pass filter that will reduce the level of the high-frequency.
